data: OB Induction or Augmentation of Labour with Oxytocin (Module)
Refer to Society of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists of Canada (SOGC) Clinical Practice Guideline Induction of Labour
Routine, Reason: Pre Induction or Augmentation with Oxytocin, once
Do not order fluid bolus if contraindicated by maternal condition (e.g. significant underlying cardiovascular conditions)
500 mL, IV, once, PRN other (see comment), administer over: 10 minute, drug form: bag
250 mL, IV, once, PRN other (see comment), administer over: 10 minute, drug form: bag
Use low dose oxytocin if:  - All augmentations in 2nd stage  - Parous augmentation  - Grand multiparous induction and augmentation  - Vaginal birth after cesarean augmentation and induction
oxytocin titratable infusion (0.06 units/mL) in NS standard

titrate, IV, 1 milliunit/min starting rate, 1 milliunit/min minimum rate, 20 milliunit/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: Titrate by 1 to 2 milliunits/min at 30 minute intervals until regular uterine activity is established
oxytocin titratable infusion (0.06 units/mL) in NS standard

titrate, IV, 2 milliunit/min starting rate, 2 milliunit/min minimum rate, 20 milliunit/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: Titrate by 1 to 2 milliunit/min at 30 minute intervals until regular uterine activity is established
oxytocin titration Infusion (0.06 units/mL) in  D5NS Standard

titrate, IV, 2 milliunit/min starting rate, 2 milliunit/min minimum rate, 20 milliunit/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: Titrate by 1 to 2 milliunit/min at 30 minute intervals until regular uterine activity is established
Use high dose oxytocin if:  - Parous induction  - Nulliparous augmentation  - Nulliparous induction in 1st stage
oxytocin titratable infusion (0.06 units/mL) in NS standard

titrate, IV, 2 milliunit/min starting rate, 2 milliunit/min minimum rate, 20 milliunit/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: Titrate by 2 to 4 milliunit/min at 30 minute intervals until regular uterine activity is established
oxytocin titration Infusion (0.06 units/mL) in  D5NS Standard

titrate, IV, 2 milliunit/min starting rate, 2 milliunit/min minimum rate, 20 milliunit/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: Titrate by 1 to 2 milliunit/min at 30 minute intervals until regular uterine activity is established
